algorithm_technique: Process queries in reverse, using a lookup to track brought-to-top windows.
problem_summary_simple: Simulate bringing windows to the top and return the final order of windows.
problem_summary_technical: Processes queries in reverse. Uses a boolean array to mark windows brought to top, then appends remaining windows in original order.
key_insights: Processing queries in reverse simplifies the logic: the last time a window is queried, it's brought to the very top.
A boolean array (or hash set) is efficient for checking if a window has already been processed.
The final order is constructed by first adding the most recently brought-to-top windows, then the rest in their original relative order.
